result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: BIESENTHAL, NICHOLAS A
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
2:11 PM Defendant NICHOLAS A BIESENTHAL appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court, in Marquette County courtroom for NICHOLAS A BIESENTHAL. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant can see and here well. Court is appearing remotely from Marquette County. Court goes over right to appear with his attorney in front of the court. State recites agreement - defendant will plea to 2021CF71 with jail and costs and 2022CF9 and an uncharged referral from BPD from 01/13/2022 will be dismissed and read-in. Atty Johnson concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY to 2021CF71. Court orders 22CF9 and the uncharged referral from BPD from 01/13/2022 be dismissed and read-in. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2021CF71. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-9 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence. Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel to include release for work, child care and treatment, if defendant qualifies under jail rules.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

No sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 2:33 PM

letter from defendant's child

letter from defendant's child - Anna

Atty Johnson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant to all counts in both cases. Court goes over maximum penalties. Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on April 12, 2022 at 2:00 PM via zoom.

9:37 AM Defendant NICHOLAS A BIESENTHAL appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CF71 and 22CF9. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. . Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set. Statement by defendant regarding bond. Statement by DA Laspisa regarding bond. Court denied bond modification. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. 

Court will set for Arraignment Feb 22, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 9:44 AM.
Initial appearance on January 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
